Quantitative Reasoning for Ecosystem Science 1 Introduction Navigating this site

Quantitative Reasoning for Ecosystem Science Caitlin C. Mothes, PhD 2022-12-30 1 Introduction This site hosts the lab curriculum for Colorado State University’s ESS 330 course: Quantitative Reasoning for Ecosystem Science Navigating this site The table of contents on the left allows you to navigate to the lesson for each week of the course. Each lesson will walk you through working through the topic, analysis, etc. for that week with exercises at the end of the lesson that will be that week’s homework assignment. Homework will be submitted through Canvas and exercise questions (including any code, figures, etc.) must be submitted in Word or PDF format. The Intro to R lesson will walk through how to create R Markdown documents in R, which you will use to write your code/answers to the exercises and then render to either Word or PDF report which is what you will submit through Canvas.

2 Introduction to spreadsheets and Excel All chapters start with a first-level heading followed by your chapter title, like the line above. There should be only one first-level heading (#) per .Rmd file. 2.1 A section All chapter sections start with a second-level (##) or higher heading followed by your section title, like the sections above and below here. You can have as many as you want within a chapter. An unnumbered section Chapters and sections are numbered by default. To un-number a heading, add a {.unnumbered} or the shorter {-} at the end of the heading, like in this section.
